nodes.title: Batch Processing Mask Replacement (Positive)
widgets_values: Fill in the padded or blank area in the image, ensuring the filled portion seamlessly blends with the surrounding content. The filled area should match the texture, colors, and patterns of the existing parts of the image, creating a natural and coherent extension of the scene.

nodes.title: Batch Processing Mask Replacement (Negative)
widgets_values: face, people, crowd, man, person, woman, child, kid, watermark, text, logo,

nodes.title: EXPAND ALL PEOPLE MASKS FOR INPAINTING
EXPAND ALL PEOPLE MASKS FOR INPAINTING
REMOVE MAIN FIGURE FROM ALL PEOPLE
COMBINE OUTPAINT & AND OTHER PEOPLE MASKS
RE-SIZING NOTE
widgets_values:
NOTE:  
The quality of the image may change during this step. This is because of the resizing process. The node that causes this is labeled as:

PAD IMAGE TO SIZE

Changing the "upscale_method" can affect the output.

Usually any kind of re-sizing process will have an impact on the image.

If you compare the image up to this point, you will notice that the subject should be identical to the original image, pixel for pixel (Unless one of the masks got close to the face during a step.)

When we reduce the size of the image we are losing the number of pixels, thus the quality may suffer.
